pullRequest.body:
It is mathematically true that a frame is a Heyting algebra. However we want nice defeqs, so we can't just provide an instance defining `himp` as some supremum. Instead, we need `Frame` to directly extend `HeytingAlgebra`.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #12730
- [x] depends on: #12731
- [x] depends on: #15005
- [x] depends on: #15006

I'm not exactly sure why there's a non-defeq diamond showing up in the `OrderDual` instances but not in the `Prod` ones.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
It seems like because `BooleanAlgebra` doesn't extend from `BiheytingAlgebra`, things later break down in `CompleteBooleanAlgebra`, as now there are two ambient instances for `(Co)heytingAlgebra`: the ones *extended* from `CompleteDistribLattice`, and the ones *synthesized* from `BooleanAlgebra`.

**Edit:** I narrowed this down further to `BooleanAlgebra` not `extend`ing `HNot`, but it insteads synthesizes it through its implementation of `BiheytingAlgebra`. Although that doesn't seem to be the only issue...
I've split out #11238 from this to reduce the diff a little.

### PR summary [e4958e9ee1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10560/commits/e4958e9ee178297d89f1f4c2fe85421975f11078)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CompleteDistribLattice.MinimalAxioms`
`+ CompletelyDistribLattice.MinimalAxioms`
`+ Order.Coframe.MinimalAxioms`
`+ Order.Frame.MinimalAxioms`
`+ coe_compl`
`+ coe_himp`
`+ coe_hnot`
`+ coe_sdiff`
`+ completelyDistribLatticeMinimalAxioms`
`+ frameMinimalAxioms`
`+ iInf_iSup_eq'`
`+ iInf_sup_eq`
`+ iInf_ulift`
`+ iInf_unique`
`+ iSup_iInf_eq`
`+ iSup_inf_eq`
`+ iSup_ulift`
`+ iSup_unique`
`+ inf_iSup_eq`
`+ inf_iSupâ‚‚_eq`
`+ inf_sSup_eq`
`+ instFrame`
`+ instGeneralizedCoheytingAlgebra`
`+ instHImp`
`+ instHNot`
`+ instHasCompl`
`+ instSDiff`
`+ instance (priority := 100) CompleteAtomicBooleanAlgebra.toCompleteBooleanAlgebra`
`+ instance (priority := 100) CompleteAtomicBooleanAlgebra.toCompletelyDistribLattice`
`+ instance (priority := 100) CompleteBooleanAlgebra.toCompleteDistribLattice`
`+ sInf_sup_eq`
`+ sSup_inf_eq`
`+ sup_iInf_eq`
`+ sup_iInfâ‚‚_eq`
`+ sup_sInf_eq`
`++ coframeMinimalAxioms`
`++ completeLattice`
`++ instCoframe`
`++++ of`
`- instance : Coframe (Closeds Î±)`
`- instance : Coframe (Filter Î±)`
`- instance : DistribLattice G.Finsubgraph`
`- instance : Frame (Opens Î±)`

!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/64cbbb9a-acea-4f35-b8b0-3d11bd63c850) for commit e4958e9ee178297d89f1f4c2fe85421975f11078.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/8c95d1f8-d690-45d1-90cb-bbff91b695f6/to/64cbbb9a-acea-4f35-b8b0-3d11bd63c850) against commit fb9736649730486762ec81254cb82a399a884192:
```diff
  Benchmark                               Metric         Change
  =============================================================
+ build                                   linting         -5.5%
- ~Mathlib.Order.CompleteBooleanAlgebra   instructions    45.9%
```

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10058577826/job/27801979111)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10058577826/job/27801979777)
Can you split this `where` vs `{}` cleanup to another PR? There seems to be quite a lot of it (which is good), but it seems orthogonal to adjusting the hierarchy.
Seems time-consuming to do so because I'm also changing the parents order simultaneously.
That instance can be left unchanged, since it doesn't touch `HeytingAlgebra` nor `Frame`
Nevermind, a change is required for `OrderDual.instCompleteBooleanAlgebra` to unify the `himp` and `compl` from both `BooleanAlgebra` and `CompleteDistribLattice`
I've decided to overdo things a bit to make sure the different structures (`OrderDual`, `Prod`, `Pi` mostly) align in the way their instances are defined
I'll make the split
#10588. I can deal with the merge conflicts here once that lands.
I guess that didn't help with shrinking the diff all that much, though it's certainly more readavle now. The instance renaming looks to be the cause of most of the size here
I don't have much more time to spend on this PR for the time being, but I'm happy for you to split off the renaming if you want to.
Can you either split this, or mention it in the PR description?

#12699 does the split.


As far as I can tell all the other changes in this file are just stylistic, and so probably don't belong in this PR at all?

The style changes are my attempt to make sure everything is set up correctly.

I've split them off to #12709.
I picked up this and some others in #12700
What is this porting note talking about here?
Probably the remnant of a bad merge. Will remove
I suspect this porting note is also no longer relevant.

I think all these changes can go in a separate PR. Just
```
git checkout master
git checkout -b fancy-new-branch-name
git checkout frame_heyting_algebra -- Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Finsubgraph.lean
git commit
gh pr create
```

Thanks for the tip! Maybe I'm still a git nood after all...

#15005
Thanks!
Those git commands look like a bad idea to me, that reverts all intermediate changes to `Finsubgraph`.
Can the changes to this file be cherry-picked?
How about this file? As far as I can see, these changes are basically orthogonal to your refactor. Or am I missing something?
Almost orthogonal. I need the `himp` field now
I put these changes in #15005 as well

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Make `Frame` extend `HeytingAlgebra`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `BiheytingAlgebra` instances for `Prod`, `Pi`, and `OrderDual`
[Merged by Bors] - chore(Order): Clean up frame instances
